title: For Sale:  Springfield Stainless 1911 (Target and GI) .45ACP
postcontent:
One of these 2 Springfield 1911’s(in Stainless Steel) is going to be sold… just a matter of which one.
I’ve bought a new compact .45ACP, so one of these will need to go.  I really love both of these pistols – but I really don’t shoot pistols much (just luv my rifles too much and not enough time), so my pistols are more about getting cleaned than shot (frown). Neither of these 1911’s have had a lot of rounds through them (not that it matters for a pistol) and both have been taken really well care of. So here they are:

Springfield 1911-A1 Loaded Target (Model PI9132LP)
 All Springfield Armory Loaded 1911-A1 pistols include all the modern-day improvements that used to be performed only by custom gunsmiths.  This model includes a Precision-fit forged frame, slide and barrel, front and rear cocking serrations, flat, serrated mainspring housing, lowered and flared ejection port, delta lightweight hammer, loaded chamber indicator, titanium firing pin, Carry Bevel Treatment, ambidextrous thumb safety, High-Hand Beavertail Grip Safety, dovetail front sight, premium adjustable rear sights, Torx-head grip screws and lightweight, adjustable speed trigger. Made in USA
Pistol is near perfect and comes with the original case and accessories. I bought this pistol brand new and have babied it ever since….               Asking $725

Springfield 1911-A1 GI Mil-spec Polished Stainless (Model PW9151L)
This was purchased 2nd hand and I’ve slowly upgraded this pistol. Has a highly polished finish, lightweight skeleton speed trigger, professionally worked trigger with reduced pull, improved buffalo horn grips with Torx-head grip screws, etc.  Made in USA   Pistol is in excellent condition and comes in original box with all papers and original accessories.                        Asking $625

I have quite a few 1911 parts and accessories, so I’m totally open to let you select the proper set of slide springs (from 11.5#  up to 22#) to match what you are planning to shoot,  grips (like a nice Hogue Target wrap, custom, target…).   
Please call me and leave a message or email to REDACTED. I am open to and will consider all offers (other than trades – this sale is to fund a new purchase).

If you are a Florida Resident...  I will require you to provide me with a valid Florida ID (CCWP preferred), and a signed statement that you have no prohibitions to legally owning a firearm and are a Florida resident. Face-to-face transactions ONLY unless you are willing to go through an FFL.

All others....    No FFL fees on my end as long as your FFL will accept a transfer directly from me (Non-FFL). If not, add $25 for my FFL to do the transfer.  Flat shipping fee of $35.

I have a very nice condition model 27-2 magnum with the 6 inch barrel. I have owned it for about 30 years as my desk/night stand gun. It shoots sweet and clean and looks very nice. The 27 models are referred to as the "cadillac" of S & W full size N frame revolvers. I do believe the previous owner had it reblued at some point, it has some very slight color differences in the finish, but the whole gun overall is very pretty and has not a single problem or blemish. I have shot this less than 100 times in 30 years, so very little use. An impressive gun and a great home defense weapon. A little big to carry, but I will throw in a nylon shoulder holster should you choose that option. Do a little research and you will see this is a gun made the right way and will last a long time. Would be a great gun for a hunting sidearm too. The grips are Pachmayr Presentation models. I do not have the original grips etc. Just the gun the way you see it and the holster. The price is very well below going rate on this and other sites, this is to reflect the reblue issue. Same gun reblued went for over $800 on Guns America Auction site.

title: For Sale:  Sig P229R .40 - 9 mags - 3 holsters
location: Puyallup (Also in Spokane), Washington, United States
postcontent:
This is a great package for a new gun to CCW

For sale is a used Sig P229R (purchased in 2007) in .40 S&W. This is a NON E2 model with a short extractor and original mainspring and strut. This handgun is DA/SA, and I have swapped out the factory hollow aluminum guide rod with a Bedair stainless guide rod. This adds a tiny amount of weight to the front, so it helps slightly with recoil and is a bit stronger than the factory guide rod - but is mainly just more attractive than the original one. I do also have the factory blue box the gun originally came in.

I also am including 9 standard capacity magazines for the handgun. They are .40/.357Sig 12rd magazines, and each one of them has a brand new Wolff extra strength spring in them.

The three holsters included are:

1 High Noon Custom - Slide Guard (with lining) OWB cowhide holster. This is a custom made high ride holster with belt loops that fit up to 1 3/4" belts. It has an adjustable tension screw to fine tune the strength of the retention on the holster. If you have never experienced a custom leather holster - it is AMAZING! Mass produced holsters do not have the detailed boning that custom holsters have which does not retain the handgun as well as custom holsters. If you have ever experienced a mass produced leather holster, you know that the leather becomes well-worked and soft within a month or so, but you don't have any of that with the High Noon. It will be just as rigid as it was when it was made forever.

The second holster is a Bianchi IWB concealment holster. I have carried the Sig in an "appendix carry" position as well as 3:30-4:00 and it works very well.

The third and final holster is a great range holster. It is the very popular Blackhawk Serpa holster. It includes both the belt attachment and the quick attach pancake attachment.

If you need ammo I can also make you a deal on Federal HST for CCW - but ammunition is NOT included in the asking price for this listing.

title: For Sale:  Federal HST .40S&W JHP - 100 round lots/up to 800rds
location: Puyallup (Also in Spokane), Washington, United States
postcontent:
Best CCW Ammo you can buy!

For sale is 100 rounds of Federal HST 155gr JHP for a .40S&W.
I do have more of this ammunition if you would like up to 800 rounds.

Federal released its Hydra-Shok line of ammunition to capture the law enforcement market years ago, and while it was a good round - it proved troublesome when going through barriers before reaching its target - clogging much of the time.

Federal corrected the problem by introducing a line known as HST, and it was tested extensively by the FBI upon its release in .40 caliber, and adopted as their ammunition after blowing the tests out of the water. This is currently the only ammunition I will carry as I feel like it is the only ammunition to hold a candle to the famous "Black Talon".

It's easy to find the much less desirable Hydra-Shok ammunition on the shelf, and many people are intrigued by the "post" inside the hollow point. If you do the research, and I suggest you do, you will find that HST is extremely tough to beat.

That's why HST has almost never (in my experience) been for sale on the shelves at your local gun shop - I have only ever found it online, for a premium price, and in small or limited quantities. I have recently switched to a different caliber for my preferred CCW and cannot find anywhere that sells HST in bulk, must less a place with a single box in stock right now.

I live in Puyallup, but will be willing to drive a reasonable distance to meet - or even ship if you want to pay for shipping.

Take a look here for FBI Protocol test results on this ammunition
http://le.atk.com/ammunition/federal/handgun/details.aspx?id=567

title: For Sale:  Standard Pressure Short Barrel Low Flash Heavy .38 Special Ammo - 158 gr. Soft Lead SWC-HC (850fps/M.E. 253 ft. lbs.) - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=110

Due to customer demand, we've developed this defensive 38SPL ammo. Our customers wanted some devastating 38SPL loads that would fill the following criteria. 

1. It won't hurt older/fragile/alloy revolvers. (Non +P)
2. Is effective as a "fight stopper" through the use of proper bullets. 
3. Is more powerful than typical/standard, weak 38SPL ammo.
4. Generate much less recoil than our +P 38SPL ammo.
5. Is flash suppressed.

Buffalo Bore is introducing these three different heavy, yet standard pressure loadings for 38 SPL. These offerings are loaded at standard pressure, but they are much more powerful than normal 38SPL ammo. These loads will not harm older more fragile revolvers. So, these loads are safe for use in ANY 38 SPL revolver, provided it is in normal working condition. As stated above, the "POWER" level of these loads is really closer to a typical +P power level, but the pressure is standard. We are able to develop these powerful standard pressure loads with modern non-canister powders. Again, these loads recoil far less than our +P 38 SPL ammo. 

All three of these loads are flash suppressed, so firing them in the dark wont blind you. We use flash suppressed powder in our defensive ammo, in the loadings we can, because over 90% of all civilian shootings in America, occur in low light, when the criminal element is at work. We don't want you blinded by your own gunfire after the first shot. 

Item 20C utilizes the same 158gr. very soft lead cast, SWC-HC gas checked bullet, we load in our +P 38 SPL ammo. It is designed to expand and then penetrate quite deep. (Approx. 14 inches in human tissue) This bullet is gas checked and will NOT lead your barrel. Note the below velocities that I recorded out of my personal revolvers- NOT TEST BARRELS!

1. S&W mod. 60, 2 inch barrel - 854 fps (256 ft. lbs.)
2. S&W mod. 66, 2.5 inch barrel - 871 fps (266 ft. lbs.)
3. Ruger SP101, 3 inch barrel - 930 fps (303 ft. lbs.)
4. S&W Mt. Gun, 4 inch barrel - 979 fps (336 ft. lbs.)

Brand new Sig Sauer STX

The 1911 STX from the SIG SAUER Custom Shop is a two-tone 1911 that’s loaded with features. This non-railed pistol features a Nitron® slide over a Natural Stainless frame and is accented by beautiful custom wood grips. The slide is further accented by polished cocking serrations and a Flat Top which enhances the two-tone aspect of this pistol. The slide is topped off with adjustable combat night sights while the frame is outfitted with a magwell for fast smooth reloads. The all stainless steel frame and slide of the STX are machined to exacting tolerances and hand-fitted to insure reliability and performance. The frame features 25-line per inch checkering on the front strap – while the mainspring housing has 20-line per inch checkering – and both the frame and slide are de-horned for comfortable full-size carry. Like all SIG SAUER products the 1911 STX pistol contains only premium internal parts including a match grade barrel, hammer/sear set and trigger. For safety the 1911 STX features a beavertail grip safety with speed bump, extended ambidextrous thumb safety, firing pin safety and hammer intercept notch and ships in a plastic gun case with cable lock.

title: For Sale:  R.H. Ruana vintage "M" 25C Knife w/sheath
postcontent:
I bought this knife in Lakewood, Colorado in about 1979 from a friend who had been to Bonner, Montana.  He bought a box of knives from Rudy Ruana and sold them to a group of us gathered to learn wilderness survival techniques.  Our knife was one of our main survival tools (2nd only to our brain).  This knife has enough weight to do the work of a small axe, and the length to be a small machete.

It saw average use for about 4 years, then was put away for about 20.  It's been carried on a couple of hunting trips in the last decade, but that's all.

Ruana knives are not very common, and this configuration is less common than most.  Look at the bone on the handle.  I've seen some as nice, but never seen any nicer.  Everything is tight and smooth.  The sheath might could use a shot of saddle soap, but this was a tool, not some 'safe queen'.  It could be spiffed up for display, but I'm not into that.

You won't be disappointed with this knife.  I currently have it listed on E-Bay, so depending on the auction, any deal we want to make may be delayed.  This listing will evaporate when the knife is no longer available.

title: For Trade:  Graphic Design and Photography Services
postcontent:
I am a professional graphic designer and photographer with over a decade of experience. I run my own company and I have several dedicated clients around the Columbus area. However, I am willing to pick up side projects in my down time on a "barter" basis for people who may not have the cash to hire a creative professional.

I typically provide things such as flyers, logos, business cards, letterhead, artwork for commercial vehicles, website graphics, product photography, executive portraits, etc. Please be aware that I am not able to print anything myself (I do not run a print shop). But I can provide artwork for any type of printed project. Please note that I also provide a variety of photography services but I do not photograph weddings. 

As far as barter items go, I am willing to provide creative work in exchange for things like firearms, ammo, accessories, hunting gear, guitars, amplifiers, music equipment and other "guy stuff". We all know that money is tight nowadays so I am happy to provide work on a trade basis as long as it does not interfere with my paying customers.

I prefer to keep my actual business separate from this posting so I have not listed my website on this ad. However, I am happy to provide a link with samples of my work upon request. Serious inquiries only please.

If you would like to hire me in the more traditional sense, please contact me through this posting and I will provide you with more information on my services, rates, availability, etc.

title: For Sale:  Surgeon Rifles Remedy 338 Norma Manners T5-A camo
postcontent:
Visa, Mastercard, Discover and American Express all accepted!!!

I also take trades like hunting rifles, tactical rifles, handguns and quality optics. Just email me directly at sales@darcopsarmory.com or use the gunbroker ask seller a question feature and tell me what you have. Maybe we can work out a trade or use it as a partial down payment.

WE DO SHIP TO CALIFORNIA! It is up to you, the buyer, to make sure this is legal in your area, and if it is we are an approved seller to the state of California and are more than happy to serve you.

We are an FFL and will accept trade-ins, shipped to us or brought in locally, from individuals. No need to pay your FFL a fee for doing it when we can walk you through the process.

I also set up payment plans on expensive items like this one so just email me and let me know what down payment and monthly payment you can afford and maybe we can put it on lay-a-way for you.

Hello and thank you for checking out our auction. Up for auction is a Mint Surgeon Remedy XL 338 Norma with Custom Camo on a Manners T5-A stock, Jewell trigger, with muzzel break, Harris Bipod. We are a Surgeon Rifles Dealer and have many or their rifles in stock. All Surgeon Rifles come with a .5 MOA or better Guarantee. Everyone we have sold so far, and its a lot, shoot 1/4 MOA or better!



Surgeon Rifles:
GUARANTEE
Why are Surgeon Rifles the right choice for you?

Surgeon is committed to producing the best products available and at a competitive price. Surgeon Rifles stand behind all it's products with a LIFETIME GUARANTEE. If at any time, any of our products, that we manufacture, fail due to defects in material or workmanship, we will repair or replace it.

About Us:
SURGEON RIFLES USE THE MOST UP TO DATE MACHINES AVAILABLE TODAY.

We have (7) 4 axis CNC mills, (3) CNC lathes, and a 5 axis CNC wire EDM machine that is capable of holding tolerances of .00005 of an inch (that is fifty millionths). We use the wire EDM machine to cut the bolt bore and raceways in all of our actions in order to produce accurate and consistant parts.

Surgeon Rifles use the latest equipment, techniques and products to produce the most accurate rifles on the market.

Surgeon actions and bolts are machined from a solid piece of aircraft grade steel, therefore creating one of the most accurate and strongest actions available on the market today.

The MCS-T5A stock is offered in two version a T5 non adjustable cheek and the T5A with a adjustable cheek and KMW hardware. The T5A version is designed as a right hand grip, with a small thumb rest on the left side of the stock. The T5 non adjustable cheek version has a ambidextrous grip.

Although the T5A version is a right hand stock, we designed it so that if you have to shoot with your weak hand it stills feels good. A lot of time went into the design of the grip on this stock, it moves your hand down and forward so your trigger finger is in a more natural position and you are not having to reach for the trigger. The area behind the trigger looks odd but it is designed to make your hand return to the same spot each time you grip the stock. It works very well with all sizes of hands, small or large.

Both versions come standard with a fixed 1 Pachmyer Decelerator pad. It can also be ordered with the optional butt spacer system and a 1/2 Decelerator pad .The standard weight for the T5A is 4.0 lbs. And the T5 is 2.7 lbs. The forend is 2.40” wide at the tip and will take barrels up to 1.350 inches in diameter. The very top end of the forend is designed with a slight flare to accept the Badger Ordance EFR night vision mount. It also has a butt hook that can be used to ride the bags or control your rifle with your non-trigger hand. The MCS-T5 was designed around a Rem 700 style action, but can be had for Winchester, Savage, Howa and other actions. For a complete list please check out the order online/stock builder, or call for more details.

title: For Sale:  Colt Army Special  32-20  D.A. 6"bbl Revolver  Very Nice  $585 O.B.O.
postcontent:
Colt Army Special .32-20 WCF -- Double Action Revolver - Mf'd 1910 - 
Make: Colt’s Patent Firearms Mfg. Co.
Model: Army Special
Serial Number: 322798
Year of Manufacture: 1910

Caliber: .32-20 W.C.F. (Winchester Center Fire) / .32-20

Action Type: Single Action and Double Action Swing Out Cylinder Revolver

Markings: The top of the barrel is marked “COLT’S PT.F.A. MFG.CO. HARTFORD, CT. U.S.A / PAT’D AUG.5.1884 JUNE 5.1900 JULY 4.1905”. The left side of the barrel is marked “COLT”, “ARMY / SPECIAL”, and “32-20 W.C.F.”. The crane cut is marked “322798” and the crane is marked “322798”. There is the Colt “VP” proof mark at the top left front of the trigger guard and a “3” at the top left rear of the trigger guard. The left side plate is marked with a Rampant Colt over a stylized “C”.

Barrel Length: 6”

Sights / Optics: This revolver is mounted with a fixed half round blade front sight. There is a round notch groove milled into the top strap for a fixed rear sight.

Stock Configuration & Condition: The two piece grips are checkered hard rubber with “COLT” logos in an oval at the top, and a “C” surrounding the grip screw. There are no chips or cracks or notable scratches in either grip panel. . These grips have survived 100 years with no damage. The grips rate in about Fine to Excellent overall condition.

Type of Finish: Blue

Finish Originality: All Original

Bore Condition: The bore is almost bright and the rifling is sharp. 

Overall Condition: This revolver retains most all of its original blue finish. The finish is worn at the muzzle and there is gray patina on the frame between the grips.  The screw heads are sharp and are as new. The markings are clear. Overall, this revolver rates in about Very Good to Fine condition.

Mechanics: The action functions correctly both single action and double action. 
Box, Paperwork & Accessories: None
My assessment: The Colt Army Special was brought out in 1908, about two years before this particular example was manufactured. The “Army Special” was later renamed the “Official Police”. This caliber ammunition is still commercially available. This caliber was popular as a small game cartridge and was offered in both revolvers and rifles. You can still enjoy shooting this revolver, either for it’s ability to harvest small game or for its ability to control pests and varmints. It makes a decent home protection gun as well. 

My grandfather purchased this Colt revolver new and it has passed to me. I have shot only three rounds through it and that may be the extent of it's use.  This is a real nice "cowboy" gun.  Very well balanced and a pleasure to hold.  I have enjoyed owning this gun and it has never failed to impress those friends that I have showed it to.  I live aboard a boat now and sail it to Canada frequently which requires that I must find a someone to babysit my Colt each time.  Owing it is simply no longer practical for me and it's time I find a new, good home for the Colt Army Special.

title: For Sale:  WW2 Colt 1911A1 US Army shipped Dec 1943 NR!
location: New York, New York, United States
postcontent: Late 1943 WW2 Colt 1911A1 US Army 1911A1. 45ACP. 1.15M serial number placing shipment from Colt in December of 1943. Substantially correct pistol with original finish, correct GHD inspector mark and matching P’s on frame and slide. Ordnance wheel in the as it should be. Feedramp is in the white as well. Slide is correctly unnumbered as this practice stopped with Colt several months prior to production of this one. Correct checkered slide stop and safety (thick tab, checkered on both sides) as well as wide colt hammer. Large ring reinforced grips with G marked general shaver magazine. Correct checkered mainspring housing. The barrel is a beautiful (inside and out) High Standard with original blue and bright shiny bore. Colt made their own barrels during this time, so I’ll leave it up to the next buyer if they want to “make it correct” adding a Colt 45 Auto marked barrel. Original finish is very good with some light scattered marks and a touch of light pitting on ride side of slide – not bad actually. A nice WW2 Colt offered with NO RESERVE!

location: Town N Country/Oldsmar, Tampa/St. Pete, Florida
postcontent:
I have a Diamondback DB380 for sale. I recently bought it off my buddy, he had problems with it failing to eject brass. He sent it to diamondback and they said there is nothing wrong with it and they sent it back to him. I polished the barrel, feedramp, slide tabs and frog lubed everything. I took it to the range and ran through two winchester white boxes, and half a box of hornady zombie max without any issues.(pretty sure my buddy was limp wristing the gun causing it to jam) It did not like the steel cases Tulammo. This is a small pistol that you can throw in your pocket. The only reason that I am selling it is because I don't like the idea of carrying a .380. It is built very similar to a Glock, and comes apart the exact same way. The barrel could use some more polishing but the parts that are visible when the pistol is assembled look pretty good. title: For Sale:  Henry Big Boy .44 Magnum
postcontent:
The Henry Big Boy .44 Magnum for sale was only purchased 8 months ago brand new.  I had planned on using it but now need the money for Christmas.  I took it one time to an indoor range and put only 50 rounds through it; it is not even broken in yet!  This Henry is absolutely beautiful.  After I purchased it and held it I can now see why people buy these and display them without ever firing one round.  I put one box of specials and one box of magnums through at the range to test it out.  I highly recommend this rifle because the beauty of it is the variety of ammunition you can use.  If you use .44 specials, the recoil is non-existent.  Honestly, a teenager could shoot this with zero concern at all about recoil.  On the other hand if you use a .44 magnum (I used one box of Hornady LEVERevolution 225 grain FTX) this gun is all macho!  The .44 magnums go though super clean and the power is amazing!  I bought this Henry for $750.00.  The gun is in mint, brand new condition and is super clean.  When I received it, it had a very insignificant mark from the factory on the walnut butt stock so I called Henry Repeating Arms and they sent me a brand new one that I never installed.  Honestly, I just called them because I paid enough for it that I wanted it 100% perfect.  The mark on the stock is really something that most people would have let go anyway because it is so small.  I am asking $725.00 firm and will include much more for you.  You will receive an actual value of somewhere around $900.00.  Thank you very much for your time.  Please e-mail me and I will reply to you.  Included are the following:

- Henry Big Boy .44 Magnum $750.00
- New Official Henry blaze orange gun case $40.00
- Henry Big Boy walnut butt stock/brand new (exact value unkown)
- 1 box of 20 Hornady 44 Mag 225 gr FTX LEVERevolution $25.00
- 1 box of 20 Hornady 44 Special 165 gr FTX Critical Defense $25.00
- User manual

For Sale:  Smith & Wesson Shield - NIB 9MM
postcontent:
Smith & Wesson’s new M&P SHIELD™ is a slim, concealable, lightweight, striker-fired polymer pistol.  Available in 9mm, the new M&P SHIELD features a slim design combined with the proven and trusted features found in the M&P Pistol Series. From the pistol’s easily concealed one-inch profile to its optimized 18-degree grip angle, the M&P SHIELD offers professional-grade features that provide consumers with simple operation and reliable performance.

Chambered in 9mm for proven stopping power, the M&P SHIELD features a high-strength polymer frame with a black, durable, corrosion resistant finish, coated stainless steel slide and barrel.  Standard with a 3.1-inch barrel, which contributes to an overall length of 6.1 inches and an unloaded weight of 19 ounces. For fast tracking and smooth target acquisition, the M&P SHIELD is standard with a 5.3-inch sight radius and has been enhanced with a short, consistent trigger pull measuring 6.5 pounds. Featuring a quick and audible reset made possible by the striker-fired action, the M&P SHIELD allows multiple rounds to be placed on target both consistently and accurately.

.
